timeline.bodyText:
I'm not familiar with the UNINITIALIZED_WORKSPACE_ID and why it would have value -1.
But if you wish to call a CB API directly, you should always use workspaceID 0.
That will default to the tenant default workspace which should be already existing.
timeline.author: lnardai

replies.bodyText: ack. as discussed will default cluster to tenant scope and remove workspace related ids.
replies.author: smaniraju

timeline.bodyText: There should be no such endpoint, this controller will be soon removed.
timeline.author: lnardai

replies.bodyText: To be more precise, Workspace related API will be removed soon, so WorkspaceResponse should not be used
replies.author: horadla23

timeline.message:
CB-7829

1. Scope periscope cluster entities at tenant level and not workspace level, since workspace concept is deprecated.
2. Cluster within same tenant can be configured for autoscaling by tenant user as long as the authenticated user has appropriate UMS Authorization permission.

timeline.bodyText:
Where do we use this ClusterID?
I'm ok with using Name and Tenant since it might come handy on the CLI, but we are not really using clusterID anywhere.
timeline.author: lnardai

replies.bodyText: This is not used now since Id based endpoints is disabled in periscope now. This was used in Id based AlertEndpoint which is disabled but not deleted.
replies.author: smaniraju

timeline.bodyText:
Why change userCRN to userID? userID is an old concept we should rely on userCRN as much as possible.
Also I don't really get the use case why I would want to get a list based on someones CRN.
